title: feat: add pcb_copper_text support with knockout and proper mirroring
description: Add support for rendering pcb_copper_text elements in the 3D PCB viewer, implement knockout text feature, fix text mirroring logic, and improve text clarity by increasing texture resolution.
body:
Summary
 
- Add support for rendering `pcb_copper_text` elements in the 3D PCB viewer
- Implement knockout text feature (filled rectangle with text cut out)
- Fix text mirroring logic to match pcb-viewer behavior
- Improve text clarity by increasing texture resolution
 
 Changes
 
 New Features
 
**Copper Text Rendering**

- Renders `pcb_copper_text` circuit JSON elements on both top and bottom layers
- Uses texture-based rendering for visibility at all distances and angles
- Supports all 9-point anchor alignments and CCW rotation
**Knockout Text**

- Draws a filled copper rectangle with text cut out (transparent)
- Configurable padding via `knockout_padding` property
- Supports rotation - rectangle rotates with the text

**Mirroring Logic** (matches pcb-viewer behavior)

- Bottom layer: auto-mirrors text unless `is_mirrored: false`
- Top layer: only mirrors if `is_mirrored: true`

 Improvements
 
- Increased `TRACE_TEXTURE_RESOLUTION` from 50 to 150 pixels/mm for crisper small text
- Removed redundant 3D silkscreen geometry from JSCAD (now uses textures like Manifold)

title: Add packing lifecycle events and improve packing error reporting
description: Adds lifecycle events for packing operations, including error reporting and metadata emission for better debugging and UI integration.
body:
## Summary

- Introduces new lifecycle events: `packing:start`, `packing:end`, and `packing:error`.
- Emits metadata for each event, including `subcircuit_id` and `componentDisplayName`, enabling better UI hooks and debugging.
- Wraps the packing operation in a try/catch to surface errors through `packing:error` before rethrowing.
- Adds `example36` tests and snapshot outputs to verify correct event firing behavior.

title: feat(panel): Refactor grid packing for boards
description: Refactors the panel packing feature to support dynamic grid layouts and custom board outlines, enhancing the handling of boards of varying sizes.
body:
This PR introduces a significant enhancement to the panel packing feature, moving from a simple grid layout to a  
more robust and flexible system. The new implementation properly handles boards of varying sizes, including       
non-rectangular boards defined with an outline.                                                                   

Key features and improvements:                                                                                    

 • Dynamic Grid Layout: The packing algorithm now creates a grid where each column and row automatically resizes  
   to accommodate the largest board within it.                                                                    
 • Outline Support: Boards with custom outline shapes are now correctly measured and packed.                      
 • New Layout Props: The <panel> component now accepts row, col, cellWidth, and cellHeight props for more explicit
   control over the grid dimensions and layout.                                                                   
 • Refactored Logic: The packing logic has been extracted from the Panel component into a new packBoardsIntoGrid  
   utility for better separation of concerns.                                                                     
 • Board Repositioning Fix: The Board component's repositioning logic has been updated to correctly translate its 
   outline when moved, which is critical for panel layouts.                                                       

These changes allow for much more complex and efficient panelization of diverse board shapes.

title: Add Copper Text Rendering and Knockout Support to Gerber Generator
description: Adds full Gerber support for pcb_copper_text, including aperture config, vector text rendering, rotation, mirroring, and anchor alignment, with knockout mode support for proper copper cutout text.
body:
This PR adds full Gerber support for `pcb_copper_text`, including aperture config, vector text rendering, rotation, mirroring, and anchor alignment.
A unified `renderVectorText` function is introduced and used for both silkscreen and copper layers.
Knockout mode is supported via padded region drawing and polarity switching, enabling proper copper cutout text.
Two new snapshot tests validate normal copper text and knockout behavior across top and bottom layers.

title: fix: prevent false obstacle rejection by linking MST sub-routes to parent nets
description: Fixes false obstacle rejection in autorouting by linking Minimum Spanning Tree sub-routes to their parent net identifiers, ensuring valid paths are recognized as connections.
body:
The autorouter was incorrectly rejecting valid paths as "obstacle
  intersections." This happened because when a net was split into Minimum
  Spanning Tree (MST) segments (e.g., net_mst0), the connectivity solver didn't
  link these sub-segments back to the original net name (e.g., net) used by
  destination pads.

  Solution:
   1. Implemented parentNetId property propagation through the entire solver
      pipeline (NetToPointPairsSolver, CapacityPath, SimpleRouteConnection,
      etc.).
   2. Updated ConnectivityMap generation to explicitly link MST sub-routes to
      their parentNetId and mergedConnectionNames.
   3. Removed fragile regex-based name parsing (_mst stripping) in favor of
      this property-based approach.

  This ensures the solver correctly identifies destination pads as valid
  connections, not obstacles.

title: Dynamically load resvg-wasm to fix the initWasm undefined error
description: Fixes GLB export failure in browser due to undefined initWasm when resvgresvg-wasm is externalized in RunFrame.
body: Fix: GLB export failing in browser when @resvg/resvg-wasm is externalized in Runframe Problem GLB export fails in RunFrameForCli (browser) with error: `Failed to initialize WASM: TypeError: Cannot read properties of undefined (reading 'initWasm')` Root Cause The static import at the top: `import { Resvg, initWasm } from "@resvg/resvg-wasm"` When this package is externalized in a UMD bundle, the import resolves to undefined because the UMD wrapper expects window.resvgWasm which doesn't exist. Fix Replace static import with dynamic import inside `ensureWasmInitialized()`

title: feat: Visualize board outlines within panels
description: Adds support for visualizing the outlines of individual boards within a pcb_panel, improving clarity in board placement and shape, and ensures correct property inheritance from boards.
body: This PR introduces support for visualizing the outlines of individual boards within a pcb_panel. Previously, only the panel's outer boundary was rendered as a solid block, making it difficult to discern the placement and shape of the boards inside. This change adds a new texture layer that draws the outlines for each board on both the top and bottom surfaces of the panel. This feature works for both the Manifold and JSCAD rendering engines. Additionally, this PR includes a fix to ensure that when rendering a pcb_panel, it correctly inherits properties like thickness and material from the boards it contains, rather than using hardcoded defaults.

title: feat(panel): Support configurable edge padding props
description: Adds configurable edge padding properties to panel components, allowing for flexible control over the space between auto-arranged boards and the panels edges, while preserving a default 5mm margin if no padding props are supplied.
body:
This introduces configurable edge padding for <panel> components, replacing the 
previously hardcoded DEFAULT_PANEL_MARGIN.                                      

The following props have been added to <panel>:                                 

 • edgePadding                                                                  
 • edgePaddingLeft                                                              
 • edgePaddingRight                                                             
 • edgePaddingTop                                                               
 • edgePaddingBottom                                                            

This allows for more flexible panel layouts by controlling the space between the
auto-arranged boards and the panel's edges. The default behavior of a 5mm margin
is preserved if no padding props are supplied.

title: Add unified Anchor Offset Overlay for boards and groups with improved guards and UI integration
description: This PR adds a unified Anchor Offset Overlay system for boards and groups, allowing board-anchored components to display accurate xy offsets with screen-space markers and labels, while refactoring group overlays for improved detection and UI integration.
body:
This PR introduces a unified Anchor Offset Overlay system with new Board and Group overlays.
Board-anchored components now display Δx/Δy offsets with accurate screen-space markers and labels.
Group overlays were refactored to use shared guards, improved detection, and updated visual constants.
MouseElementTracker now renders both overlays consistently under all transforms.
A new board-anchor fixture demonstrates correct behavior and interactions.
Dependencies and utilities were updated to support the new overlay architecture.

title: Add support for PcbNoteLine
description: Adds support for rendering PCB note lines in the silkscreen texture generation process, including customizable stroke width, color, and dashed line options.

title: Add support for group-to-group and group-to-board PCB relative positioning with display offsets
description: Adds support for explicit PCB positioning of groups using pcbXpcbY, allowing groups to position themselves relative to a parent PCB group or the PCB board, with display offsets stored for groups.
body:
Adds support for explicit PCB positioning of groups using pcbX/pcbY. Groups can now position themselves relative to either a parent PCB group or the PCB board when no parent exists. Display offsets (display_offset_x / display_offset_y) are now stored for groups, matching existing component behavior.

Component-to-group and component-to-board positioning already worked; this PR focuses on enabling group-to-group and group-to-board cases.

Includes new tests covering both new scenarios plus regression tests for existing component behavior. Also updates related @tscircuit/props, circuit-json, and circuit-to-svg versions.

title: pcb: Add anchor offset visualization tests
description: Adds tests for visualizing anchor offsets between PCB components and groups, and between PCB groups and boards.
body:
This PR introduces two new tests to verify anchor offset visualization.                                           

 • Adds a test for visualizing the anchor offset between a pcb_group and a pcb_board.                                                                              
 • Adds a test for visualizing the anchor offset between a pcb_component and a pcb_group.

title: feat: Support NinePointAnchor-based label positioning for voltage probes
description: Adds support for rendering voltage probes with labels at any of 9 anchor positions, adjusts arrow angles and text anchor points based on label alignment, and includes a comprehensive snapshot test for all alignment options.
body: ## PR Description - Added support for rendering voltage probes with labels at any of 9 anchor positions - Flipped arrow angle from -50° to -130° for left-aligned labels (center_left, top_left, bottom_left) - Adjusted text anchor point (end vs start) based on label alignment - Added comprehensive snapshot test covering all alignment options - Updated `circuit-json` dependency version to support `label_alignment` ### Next Steps Implementing automatic voltage probe label overlap detection in `core` Ref: https://github.com/tscircuit/core/issues/1739

title: Add copper text canvas rendering with knockout, mirroring, alignment, and snapshot tests
description: This PR adds full canvas-based rendering support for pcb_copper_text, including knockout mode, mirroring, padding, and alignment handling.
body:
This PR adds full canvas-based rendering support for pcb_copper_text, including knockout mode, mirroring, padding, and alignment handling.
A new drawPcbCopperText element implements text measurement, bounding box calculation, and copper-color mapping for all layers.
CircuitToCanvasDrawer now recognizes pcb_copper_text elements and passes them to the new renderer.
Canvas context typing was expanded to support globalCompositeOperation, fillRect, and measureText.
New snapshot tests validate normal copper text and mirrored knockout behavior at different scales.
These additions complete feature parity between SVG and canvas rendering for copper text.

title: feat: Automatic label alignment selection for voltage probes
description: Implements automatic label alignment selection for voltage probes in schematic diagrams to prevent labels from overlapping with components, text, and other circuit elements.
body: ## PR Description This PR implements automatic label alignment selection for voltage probes in schematic diagrams to prevent labels from overlapping with components, text, and other circuit elements. ### Changes Made - Added utility function `selectBestLabelAlignment.ts` that: - Calculates label bounds for all 9 NinePointAnchor positions (top_left, top_center, top_right, center_left, center, center_right, bottom_left, bottom_center, bottom_right) - Computes overlap area between label and all schematic elements (components, text, boxes, ports, lines, rectangles, circles) - Selects the alignment with minimal or zero overlap - Falls back to default top_right if all positions have equal overlap - Updated `VoltageProbe.ts` component: - Integrated automatic alignment selection in `doInitialSchematicReplaceNetLabelsWithSymbols()` - Gathers all schematic elements from database before probe insertion - Automatically sets `label_alignment` property on voltage probe insertion - Updated all the related test snapshots Closes #1739

When exporting STEP files with components that have model_step_url, the mesh generation was being called unnecessarily, causing "Failed to generate component meshes" errors.

This change checks if there are any unhandled components before calling generateComponentMeshes(), skipping it entirely when all components are handled by external STEP model merging.

title: Add CopperText primitive with PCB rendering, JSX support, and snapshot tests
description: Adds a new CopperText primitive component for PCB layouts that supports copper text placement with rotation, mirroring, and knockout behavior, along with snapshot tests for validation.
body:
This PR introduces a new `CopperText `primitive component for PCB layouts.
It enables placing copper text on top and bottom layers with full support for rotation, mirroring, and knockout behavior.
The component is exposed through the public components index and registered as a JSX intrinsic element.
Circuit JSON normalization is applied to ensure consistent text encoding.
Test coverage is added with PCB snapshot tests validating normal, mirrored, rotated, and knockout cases.
The update includes a minor `@tscircuit/props` version bump required for the new component.

title: Correctly reposition board contents during panel packing
description: Updates the _repositionOnPcb method to ensure that when a board is moved, its center, outline, and child components are repositioned correctly during panel packing operations.
body:
The _repositionOnPcb method for the Board component has been updated.   
When a board is moved, it now calculates the positional delta and       
applies this transformation to the board's center, its outline, and     
recursively to all of its child components.                             

This ensures the entire board assembly, including its contents, moves as
a single, coherent unit during layout operations like panel packing.

The associated tests have been updated to use auto-packing for boards   
with internal components, which now pass correctly with this update.

title: Add option to place simulation graph above schematic in SVG output
description: Adds a new boolean option to place the simulation graph above the schematic in the SVG output generated by convertCircuitJsonToSchematicSimulationSvg.
body: This pull request adds support for placing the simulation graph above the schematic in the SVG output generated by `convertCircuitJsonToSchematicSimulationSvg`. It introduces a new `graphAboveSchematic` option, updates the implementation to support this layout, documents the new option, and adds a test to verify the new behavior. **New feature: Simulation graph positioning** * Added a new `graphAboveSchematic` boolean option to the `ConvertSchematicSimulationParams` interface and to the `convertCircuitJsonToSchematicSimulationSvg` function, allowing the simulation graph to be placed above the schematic in the SVG output. [[1]](diffhunk://#diff-963e504213b6bd8131ff24b5585e05bd6ed61ac49d233c2f702cc92f14e69d9eR26-R27) [[2]](diffhunk://#diff-963e504213b6bd8131ff24b5585e05bd6ed61ac49d233c2f702cc92f14e69d9eR44) * Updated the SVG composition logic in `convertCircuitJsonToSchematicSimulationSvg` to render the simulation graph above or below the schematic based on the `graphAboveSchematic` flag. [[1]](diffhunk://#diff-963e504213b6bd8131ff24b5585e05bd6ed61ac49d233c2f702cc92f14e69d9eR82-R95) [[2]](diffhunk://#diff-963e504213b6bd8131ff24b5585e05bd6ed61ac49d233c2f702cc92f14e69d9eR108) **Documentation** * Documented the new `graphAboveSchematic` option in the `README.md` to inform users of the new capability and its default behavior. **Testing** * Added a new test file `graph-above-schematic.test.tsx` to verify that the simulation graph is correctly positioned above the schematic when the option is enabled, and to compare the output SVG against a snapshot.

title: Add ability to detect impossible high-density routing problems before solving
description: Implements pre-validation for high-density nodes to detect obviously impossible routing problems before attempting to solve them, preventing wasted computation time on unsolvable cases.
body:
## Summary

Implements pre-validation for high-density nodes to detect obviously impossible routing problems before attempting to solve them, preventing wasted computation time on unsolvable cases.

## Key Changes

### Core Validation Logic (`isHighDensityNodeSolvable`)
- Detects overlapping port points on same layer (with proper tolerance based on via diameter + obstacle margin)
- Calculates minimum vias needed based on actual path crossings and layer changes
- Treats multi-layer ports at the same (x,y) position as "free vias" that don't consume capacity
- Returns detailed diagnostics including overlap count, crossing count, and width requirements

### High-Density Solver Integration
- Pre-checks each node before creating sub-solver
- Fails fast with descriptive error messages: "Impossible Node: [reason]"
- Maintains consistency with existing error reporting flow

### Interactive Editor Enhancements
- Added via placement tool for visual reference (purely decorative)
- Real-time solvability diagnostics in MetricsCard
- Detailed failure breakdown when node is unsolvable (overlaps, crossings, width usage)
- Global via diameter control affects both visual representation and solvability calculations

## Technical Details

**Via Calculation Formula:**
- `totalVias = totalCrossings * 2 + numLayerChangeConnections`
- Each crossing requires 2 vias (one trace goes down and back up)
- Layer changes only count when ports at different positions span multiple layers
- Multi-layer pads at same location are treated as "built-in vias"

**Overlap Detection:**
- Tolerance: `viaDiameter/2 + obstacleMargin`
- Excludes same-connection ports (entry/exit can be close)
- Only checks ports on same layer

## Benefits

- **Performance:** Instant rejection of impossible nodes (no wasted solver iterations)
- **Debugging:** Clear error messages explain why a node is unsolvable
- **Accuracy:** Respects physical constraints (via size, spacing, width limits)
- **Visualization:** Interactive tool helps understand solvability requirements

title: feat: enhance AnalogSimulationViewer with mouse drag functionality
description: Adds interactive panning functionality to the AnalogSimulationViewer component, refactors reference management, and simplifies usage in the fixture example.
body:
This pull request enhances the `AnalogSimulationViewer` component by adding interactive pan (drag-to-move) functionality, refactoring how references are managed, and simplifying the component's usage in the fixture example. The main improvements are focused on enabling users to drag the simulation view, updating styles and event handling accordingly, and cleaning up code for consistency.

**Interactive panning and event handling:**

* Added support for interactive panning by integrating the `use-mouse-matrix-transform` hook, applying CSS transforms to the SVG image, and updating the cursor to indicate dragging. Mouse and touch event handlers were introduced to manage drag state, and global listeners ensure proper drag termination. (`lib/components/AnalogSimulationViewer.tsx`) [[1]](diffhunk://#diff-14dd4a6344bace2411d788c3fd424b88f8e6404a9a46b284f6e82498dde21986R7-R8) [[2]](diffhunk://#diff-14dd4a6344bace2411d788c3fd424b88f8e6404a9a46b284f6e82498dde21986R33-R52) [[3]](diffhunk://#diff-14dd4a6344bace2411d788c3fd424b88f8e6404a9a46b284f6e82498dde21986R141-R166) [[4]](diffhunk://#diff-14dd4a6344bace2411d788c3fd424b88f8e6404a9a46b284f6e82498dde21986L196-R255)

**Refactoring and code cleanup:**

* Refactored the way refs are assigned to the container element to support both resizing and transformation logic in a single node. (`lib/components/AnalogSimulationViewer.tsx`) [[1]](diffhunk://#diff-14dd4a6344bace2411d788c3fd424b88f8e6404a9a46b284f6e82498dde21986R33-R52) [[2]](diffhunk://#diff-14dd4a6344bace2411d788c3fd424b88f8e6404a9a46b284f6e82498dde21986L196-R255)
* Removed redundant border and border-radius styles from the error display, delegating styling to the container or parent. (`lib/components/AnalogSimulationViewer.tsx`)

**Fixture and usage simplification:**

* Simplified the fixture example by removing explicit container styles from the usage of `AnalogSimulationViewer`, relying on the component's internal styling. (`examples/example15-analog-simulation-viewer.fixture.tsx`)

title: feat: add AnalogSimulationViewer component and update dependencies
description: Adds a new AnalogSimulationViewer React component for rendering SPICE simulation results and updates package dependencies to support this functionality.
body: This pull request introduces a new analog simulation viewer component and provides an example for its usage, enabling rendering of SPICE simulation results from circuit definitions. The main changes include the addition of the `AnalogSimulationViewer` React component, a comprehensive example fixture that demonstrates the end-to-end simulation and visualization workflow, and updates to the package dependencies to support these features. **New Analog Simulation Viewer Feature:** * Added a new `AnalogSimulationViewer` React component that takes a `CircuitJson` (possibly with simulation results) and renders either the simulation graph SVG or falls back to the schematic SVG. It handles loading, error states, and responsive sizing. (`lib/components/AnalogSimulationViewer.tsx`) * Exported the new `AnalogSimulationViewer` from the library entry point for external use. (`lib/index.ts`) **Example and Demonstration:** * Added a fixture/example (`examples/example15-analog-simulation-viewer.fixture.tsx`) that demonstrates converting a TSX circuit definition to CircuitJSON, running a SPICE simulation, and displaying the results using the new viewer. Includes error handling and loading states for a complete user experience. **Dependency Updates:** * Updated `tscircuit` and `circuit-json-to-spice` dependencies to newer versions to support enhanced simulation and conversion features. (`package.json`) [[1]](diffhunk://#diff-7ae45ad102eab3b6d7e7896acd08c427a9b25b346470d7bc6507b6481575d519L30-R30) [[2]](diffhunk://#diff-7ae45ad102eab3b6d7e7896acd08c427a9b25b346470d7bc6507b6481575d519L40-R40)

title: Improve corner geometry for panel tabs
description: Updates the corner extension calculation for panel tab cutouts to use trigonometry, ensuring clean mitered joins at convex corners.
body:
The previous logic for extending panel tab cutouts at convex corners    
used a fixed extension length, resulting in sharp, overlapping corners  
in the panel frame.                                                     

This PR updates the corner extension calculation to use trigonometry    
(cutoutWidth * Math.tan(angle / 2)). This creates a proper mitered join,
ensuring the outer edges of the cutouts meet cleanly and produce a      
smoother, continuous frame around the boards.

title: fix: add zOffsetFromSurface property to cadmodel documentation
description: This pull request updates the documentation for the cadmodel element to clarify and expand on how to reposition 3D models, especially with the new zOffsetFromSurface property.
body:
This pull request updates the documentation for the `cadmodel` element to clarify and expand on how to reposition 3D models, especially with the new `zOffsetFromSurface` property. It also adds a detailed properties table for easier reference.

Enhancements to documentation for model positioning:

* Added `zOffsetFromSurface` as an option for repositioning models, alongside `positionOffset` and `rotationOffset`, in the introductory section.
* Introduced a new section explaining how to use `zOffsetFromSurface` to control the vertical distance of the model from the PCB surface, including an example usage.

Documentation improvements:

* Added a comprehensive properties table listing all supported attributes for the `cadmodel` element, including types and descriptions for `modelUrl`, `stepUrl`, `positionOffset`, `rotationOffset`, `zOffsetFromSurface`, `size`, and `modelUnitToMmScale`.
